title: Warning: Vaccination death & bioweapon conspiracy theory could amplify panic
subtitle: IORG Dokidoki Alert Weekly Ôπã No. 3 Ôπè 2021.6.14-20
html:
What‚Äôs Up Last Week?

In this week‚Äôs Dokidoki Alert, IORG lists 3 suspicious narratives, plus updates on 2 of the narratives from last week. Stay alert.

Taiwanese going to China to get vaccinated

  • üì¢ Propaganda

  • Xinhua News

  • Phoenix TV 
  • Ting-ting Sees the World

X-G3GG-Y85U X-G3S8-43IV X-G3TC-E84V X-G3CX-2BWZ

Unable to disproof

The sudden deaths after vaccination was one of the hot topics of last week. According to IORG‚Äôs database, there are 3,555 related Facebook posts from Mandarin pages between June 14th and 20th. Although Taiwan‚Äôs Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) said the causality between death and vaccination needs to be verified, the decrease in the number of people getting vaccinated already reflects the public‚Äôs hesitation.

‚ÄúVaccines are a biochemical weapon,‚Äù a conspiracy theory that appeared last week might deepen people‚Äôs concern on vaccines. Since June 12th, messages X-G308-D93N containing words like ‚Äúthe inventor of mRNA vaccine platform Dr. Robert Malone regrets getting vaccinated with Moderna‚Äù started to appear. Similar content also showed up on PTT X-G3SS-9CRT and United Daily News X-G37H-OAYP. Soon after, narratives such as ‚ÄúThe U.S. Supreme Court has canceled universal vaccination‚Äù and ‚ÄúVaccines are a biochemical and genocidal weapon‚Äù started to emerge, warning people not to get vaccinated. In 2020, IORG‚Äôs research report included a conspiracy theory saying that COVID-19 virus is a biochemical weapon fabricated by the U.S. Both conspiracy theories used sources that are unverifiable, which can be considered as ‚Äúsource manipulation.‚Äù It should be noted that IORG has not yet found any direct CCP involvement in the dissemination of this narrative.

Another hot topic last week was ‚ÄúAmerica donates 2.5 million doses of Moderna to Taiwan.‚Äù Between June 19th and 20th, the dates when the American Institute in Taiwan (AIT) announced the news on its Facebook page and the arrival of the vaccines, there were at least 899 related Facebook posts from Mandarin pages. Besides showing appreciation towards the U.S., narratives saying that ‚ÄúTaiwan uses arm purchase and semiconductor chips in exchange for American vaccines‚Äù were also observed, implying that the U.S. is driven by self-interest and ill-intentioned. Chinese state media Global Times has published at least 3 articles X-G3BD-KCFP X-G36D-GTAI X-G3VX-TKAA echoing the same narratives, writing that ‚Äúthere is no free lunch‚Äù and that ‚Äúthe U.S. is only using Taiwan as its pawn to confront the mainland.‚Äù The involvement of Chinese state media shows that the CCP intends to amplify these narratives, for internal propaganda, stability maintenance, or undermining Taiwan-U.S. relations.

2 suspicious narratives mentioned in last week‚Äôs Weekly: ‚ÄúU.S. company Blackwater invested in the R&D of Taiwanese vaccine UB-612‚Äù and ‚ÄúTaiwanese going to China to get vaccinated‚Äù continued to spread. IORG found more pro-China celebrities and local collaborators who participated in spreading these narratives. In an interview video X-G32F-Z7HQ with Wang Ping-chung (ÁéãÁÇ≥Âø†) published on Xigua Video (Ë•øÁìúË¶ñÈ†ª), a Chinese online video-sharing platform owned by ByteDance, former Taiwan legislator Chiu Yi (ÈÇ±ÊØÖ) claimed that ‚ÄúBlackwater offers personal protections to President Tsai Ing-wen‚Äù, and that Tsai wants to ‚Äúuse force to reject reunification‚Äù (‰ª•Ê≠¶ÊãíÁµ±) and to ‚Äúuse force to plot for independence‚Äù (‰ª•Ê≠¶Ë¨ÄÁç®). Huang Chih-hsien (ÈªÉÊô∫Ë≥¢), a Taiwanese TV commentator, wrote in a Facebook post X-G39C-HIXG that America uses Blackwater to conduct ‚Äúhuman experiment‚Äù in Taiwan in order to ‚Äúproduce biochemical weapon that targets the Chinese‚Äù. Another TV commentator Sisy Chen (Èô≥ÊñáËåú) also said in her TV program X-G3CZ-AAHU that ‚ÄúThe founder of Blackwater has registered a new company in Hong Kong‚Äù to ‚Äúassist the PLA to train African special forces.‚Äù When combined with the emotional calling of ‚ÄúTaiwanese going to China to get vaccinated,‚Äù these suspicious narratives could change the perception and preference of vaccines among the Taiwanese public.

The famous content farm Mission (ÂØÜË®ä) and its Chinese connection was revealed by The Reporter in 2019. Sharing of links from the content farm was banned by Facebook in the same year. However, Mission resurrected itself with a new domain ‚Äúpplomo.com‚Äù and is alive and well. According to IORG‚Äôs database, between June 14th and 20th, there are 660 Facebook pages conducted ‚Äúclustered posting‚Äù, and the domain most-shared among these clustered posts is the one of Mission, with a total of 101 links being shared in a short period of time. The Facebook pages that share Mission‚Äôs links the most frequently are: ‚ÄúSuperwoman Blue Warrior‚Äù (Á•ûÂäõÂ•≥Ë∂Ö‰∫∫ËóçÊà∞Â∞á), ‚ÄúBlue Sky R.O.C. Once More‚Äù (ËóçÂ§©ÂÜçÁèæ‰∏≠ËèØÊ∞ëÂúã), ‚ÄúChinese Chat‚Äù (ËèØ‰∫∫ËÅäÂ§©), ‚ÄúEmpty Tsai Government‚Äù (Á©∫ÂøÉËèúÊîøÂ∫ú), and ‚ÄúCivilian Daily Life‚Äù (Ê∞ëÈñìÂ§ßÂ∞è‰∫ã).

The ever-changing nature of this pandemic provides opportunities for suspicious messages to exploit the worry, fear, and panic that we all have. False information, information manipulation, and sometimes conspiracy theories. IORG is here with you to stay alert, stay calm, trust in science, and fact-check actively.

Full version of this Dokidoki Alert Weekly is available in Taiwanese Mandarin. Please visit https://iorg.tw/da/3 for more...
